page.title: 13EATON HALL FARM (Past)
page.content: Mr.G.S.Allen is 86 years old and was the previous owner of Eaton Hall farm. He owned the farm for 41 years from 1920.He used to run the farm with his brothers,when it used to cover 226 acres.50 of these acres were ploughed by horses.They produced milk from 60 Fresian and Short horn cows.They also kept 60 breeding sheep and 12 pigs. Electricity was not installed on the farm until 1969 and paraffin lanterns were originally used.The house was heated by coal which was collected by horse and cart from Rocester railway station, which is no longer in existence. The farm grounds contain the foundations of Eaton Hall which has not been a building for many centuries. It is alleged that King Charles 1 stayed one night at the Hall.
